item.title: Mentioned by News Talk 650 CKOM
item.description:
MP Clarke defends calling proposed riding changes 'gerrymandering'
Northern Saskatchewan MP Rob Clarke on Wednesday defended calling the proposed Saskatchewan riding boundary changes “gerrymandering” during a parliamentary committee meeting. He used the term “gerrymandering” Tuesday against the electoral ... On Wednesday, he said the commission has forced him as a Member of Parliament now to drive an hour to an hour-and-a-half through another riding to get to the northeast section of the constituency. “Also, what the commission has come out and said is that as ...

item.title: Mentioned by StarPhoenix
item.description:
Clarke critical of electoral boundaries commission
The member of Parliament for northern Saskatchewan has accused the Saskatchewan Federal Electoral Boundaries Commission of "gerrymandering" its proposed changes to federal electoral districts. Desnethe-Missinippi-Churchill River MP Rob Clarke made the comment Tuesday while presenting his objection to the proposed boundary changes to a parliamentary committee in Ottawa. As the committee on procedure and house affairs heard objections from seven Saskatchewan MPs Tuesday, Liberal MP ...
